title: Ezra’s Prayer of Confession
summary: Ezra is devastated when he learns that many Israelites, including leaders, have intermarried with pagan nations. He tears his clothes and prays a deep prayer of confession and grief, acknowledging God’s mercy and Israel’s unfaithfulness.

faq.question: What caused Ezra’s grief?
faq.answer: The people had married foreign women, violating God's command.

faq.question: How did Ezra respond?
faq.answer: He prayed in sorrow and confessed the sins of the nation before God.
